entries.title: Recovery efforts are underway off coast near location where balloon was taken down, US official says
Pope Francis pleads for peace as he meets South Sudanese people displaced by war
entries.description: Pope Francis called for peace on Saturday as he met a group of several hundred South Sudanese people internally displaced by war at an event in the country's capital Juba.

entries.title: Biden has discussed options with military brass
entries.description: President Joe Biden said Saturday his administration would handle a suspected Chinese spy balloon traversing the eastern United States.

entries.title: Winter storm brings US record low for wind chill
entries.description: A life-threatening cold spell began to ease its grip on the northeastern United States on Saturday, but only after a new national windchill record was set in New Hampshire.

entries.title: Ukrainian tank crews 'quick to master' Challenger 2 in training, UK says
Ukrainian tank crews 'quick to master' Challenger 2 in training, UK says
entries.description: • American aid worker killed in Ukraine

entries.title: Ford Mustang Mach-E has a mile of wires it doesn't need. That's a big deal
entries.description: Ford showed this week that it's not going to be as easy for traditional automakers to catch Tesla in the race to build the better electric vehicle, despite what Tesla's doubters think.

entries.title: Sci-fi ideas that could change the future of space exploration
entries.description: In the past year, a tiny helicopter flew on Mars, a NASA spacecraft slammed into an asteroid and the James Webb Space Telescope revealed dazzling new insights about the universe.

entries.title: Frontier Airlines announces new unlimited summer flight pass
entries.description: Call it the summer buffet of air travel.

entries.title: A look at China's history of spying in the US
entries.description: The suspected Chinese surveillance balloon that violated American airspace this week has fueled a diplomatic crisis with the postponement of Secretary of State Anthony Blinken's planned trip to Beijing.

entries.title: MRIs show racism and poverty may alter brain development of Black children, study says
entries.description: Black children living in poverty face increased instances of stress and trauma that can alter their brain development, a new study found.

entries.title: Indiana man dies after falling from Puerto Rico cliff while filming a TikTok video
entries.description: An Indiana man died after falling from a cliff in Puerto Rico while trying to make a video for TikTok, according to his family.

entries.title: Analysis: We may owe Pamela Anderson an apology, but she's just fine without one
entries.description: Times have changed, and over the past few years it feels like there has been a reckoning when it comes to the treatment of women in Hollywood.

entries.title: Why Tom Brady's unretirement and second retirement doesn't harm his legacy
entries.description: Not a single soul born in the 21st century has seen an NFL season without Tom Brady.

entries.title: When and where could LeBron James break the NBA's all-time scoring record
entries.description: There are few certainties in sport, but LeBron James breaking the NBA's all-time scoring record is one of them. It is now a question of when, not if, this remarkable record chase will be achieved.

entries.title: A mom took her dog for a walk in northern England last week. Her partner says she 'vanished into thin air'
entries.description: On a cold January morning, a mother-of-two dropped her young daughters off at school before taking her springer spaniel for their usual walk by the river.

entries.title: A vulnerable power grid is in the crosshairs of domestic extremist groups
entries.description: Gunshots fired at two power substations in Moore County, North Carolina, late last year left 45,000 homes and businesses without power and more attacks just like that could already be planned by domestic extremist groups, according to experts.

entries.title: 24-year-old giant panda Le Le dies at Memphis Zoo
entries.description: Le Le, a 24-year-old male giant panda, died at the Memphis Zoo earlier this week, according to officials.

entries.title: Five players ejected in a mass brawl marring the Orlando Magic's victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves
entries.description: Five players were ejected after a fight, in which punches were thrown and almost every player on the court was involved, marred the Orlando Magic's 127-120 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.

entries.title: Misbehaving tourists of 2023: Couple abandons baby at check-in
entries.description: Our weekly travel newsletter brings you snapshots of what's happening around the world right now, from the delivery of the last Boeing 747 to a selfie-loving Colorado bear and former monasteries for sale in Italy.

entries.title: Gautam Adani lost half his wealth in a flash. Here's what happened
entries.description: Less than two weeks ago, Gautam Adani was the fourth-richest person in the world. With a personal fortune estimated at $120 billion, the self-made Indian industrialist was wealthier than either Bill Gates or Warren Buffet.

entries.title: Why your dream European vacation is already booked solid
entries.description: When it comes to planning a European vacation, travel industry experts have traditionally advised tourists hoping to save money and avoid crowds to visit popular destinations like Italy, France, and Spain in off-season windows, like late winter or early spring.

entries.title: Former Sex Pistol John Lydon loses out on bid to represent Ireland at Eurovision
entries.description: Former Sex Pistols frontman John Lydon has failed to land the spot in representing Ireland with his band Public Image Ltd (PiL) in this year's Eurovision Song Contest.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores his first goal for new club Al Nassr
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will be remembered as one of soccer's most prolific goalscorers. But, surprisingly for a player who is usually so lethal in front of goal, it has taken the forward longer than many expected for him to find the net with his new club Al Nassr.

entries.title: Cancer is striking more people in their 30s and 40s. Here's what you need to know
entries.description: It's World Cancer Day, and the outlook for winning the war against this deadly disease is both good and bad.

entries.title: Massachusetts police on the hunt for 200-pound stolen Shrek statue
entries.description: Shrek is love, Shrek is life, Shrek is... missing?

entries.title: American volunteer aid worker killed in Bakhmut while helping Ukrainian civilians
entries.description: An American volunteer aid worker, Pete Reed, was killed in the eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut on Thursday while aiding civilians, according to a statement from Global Response Medicine, the humanitarian aid group he founded.

entries.title: Biden is being constantly briefed on suspected Chinese spy balloon
Traumatized and afraid, Jenin residents are still reeling from Israeli raid
entries.description: Mohammed Abu al-Hayja was sleeping alongside his wife and two young daughters last month when loud gunfire woke them up. Minutes later, Israeli soldiers rammed down his door and burst through his apartment.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak has had a torrid first 100 days as Britain's leader. But the Conservatives might not be doomed
entries.description: Earlier this week, Rishi Sunak celebrated his first 100 days as prime minister of the United Kingdom.

entries.title: Blinken postpones China trip, says priority is to get balloon out of US airspace
Here's what we know about the suspected Chinese spy balloon
entries.description: A suspected Chinese surveillance balloon in the skies over the continental United States has sparked national security and diplomatic concerns, adding to already tense Washington-Beijing relations.

entries.title: Reporter says this is Democrats' fatal flaw
entries.description: New York Times reporter Brett Stephens and Rep. Ruben Gallego (D- AZ) discuss issues the Democratic party is facing reaching constituents with Bill Maher.

entries.title: 'It's tone deaf': Finney on Black History Month police cruisers
entries.description: Two police departments, one in Miami and another in Columbus, Ohio, are facing criticism after unveiling police cruisers wrapped in Black History Month artwork. CNN political commentator Karen Finney and Former Head of Intelligence at DC Homeland Security Department Donell Harvin join Laura Coates to discuss.

entries.title: Here's how spy balloons work
entries.description: Officials are still tracking a suspected Chinese spy balloon as it travels across the US. CNN's Brian Todd reports on how spy balloons work and how they are equipped.

entries.title: She used hidden cameras to help students cheat exams. Now she's wanted by Interpol
entries.description: Think "international manhunt" and the image that likely springs to mind is that of a hardened criminal like a murderer, bank robber or billion-dollar fraudster -- not the middle-aged boss of a high school tuition center.

entries.title: Japan's workers haven't had a raise in 30 years. Companies are under pressure to pay up
Elon Musk wins lawsuit over 'funding secured' tweet
entries.description: A California jury has ruled that Elon Musk is not liable for losses experienced by Tesla shareholders following his controversial "funding secured" tweet from 2018.
